cab.content: From Viceroy, Army Department, to Secretary of Stale for India, 15/Ji April 1920.(Received 8 p.m.)4795.Part I. (1) Waziristan. Further instalments of Government rifles received from Tochi Waziris, who now appear to be making genuine effort to collect remainder. Sharnen Khei, smallest of three main Mahsud sections, have now handed in full share of fine and all Government rifles in their possession. Mahsuds of sections which have complied with terms have been allowed to return to land and property near Kaniguram.(2) Afghanistan. In recent Darbars in Kabul, Amir reported to have stated that he wished excitement amongst frontier tribes to cease, and that he ] wanted to make peace with British, but latter do not reciprocate his feelings.(3) Tone of Afghan Press continues anti-British and Pan-Islamic, and rumours are current of the possibility of declaration of holy war. There is no evidence to show that such is contemplated.Part II.-NilParas. (2) and (3) not given to Press.
